title: Bob Bryan
summary: Robert Charles Bryan (born April 29, 1978) is an American former doubles world No. 1 tennis player.[2] He has won twenty-three Grand Slam titles: 16 in men's doubles and 7 in mixed doubles. He turned professional in 1998. With his twin brother Mike, he was the world No. 1 doubles player for several years, first achieving the top ranking in September 2003. The brothers were named ATP Team of the Decade for 2000â€“2009.[3] The brothers became the second men's doubles team to complete the Career Golden Slam at the 2012 Summer Olympics.
